definitions.text: the Crown (or the reigning monarch) as the symbol of the power and authority of a monarchy
examples: the colonies revolted against the Crown

definitions.text: the part of a tooth above the gum that is covered with enamel
a wreath or garland worn on the head to signify victory
an ornamental jeweled headdress signifying sovereignty
the part of a hat (the vertex) that covers the crown of the head
the upper branches and leaves of a tree or other plant
the top or extreme point of something (usually a mountain or hill)
examples: the view from the peak was magnificent
they clambered to the tip of Monadnock
the region is a few molecules wide at the summit

definitions.text: the award given to the champion
(dentistry) dental appliance consisting of an artificial crown for a broken or decayed tooth
examples: tomorrow my dentist will fit me for a crown

definitions.text: the center of a cambered road

examples: The prince was crowned in Westminster Abbey
A weather vane crowns the building
